resources.string: Are you sure you want to delete this item?

Network traffic counter for EDGE/3G/4G and Wi-Fi with localization capability.
Locates the device using Wi-Fi fingerprints and/or BTLE beacons. Able to send traffic counter information via OSC to other devices.
User can Export/Import data to/from the SD card and upload to a remote server.
Available in English only
Developed within the SINLAB research project, by Louis David Jean Magarshack in collaboration with Selena Savić
Version 3.1 (2.2?)
GNU GPL v3 License

Connect or Not is produced as part of the "Emperor\'s New Architecture" doctoral research which explores the relationship between wireless communication infrastructure and the built space and structures. Connect or Not applications is used as a tool to collect data for practical experimentation and prototyping of interactive environments. Traffic counting is based on Netcounter developed by Cyril Jaquier. Localization is using the Redpin positioning system developed by Philipp Bolliger at ETH Zurich. For more information visit the homepage

The aim of the "Emperor\'s New Architecture" research is to analyse how wireless networks inhabit physical space. Can the presence of wireless signals define the space and its use in a similar way like physical structure does? What happens when wireless signals meet the built environment? How can we explore the electromagnetic space formed by our wireless communication? How can we give shape to this space?
ConnectOrNot actively captures your smartphone’s usage of cell towers and WIFI traffic exchange. However, it does not record or save any personal information (like websites you browse, HTTP packets, passwords, etc) It only records the quantities of data exchange. Thus, it is using your phone as an electromagnetic metering device.
Besides the traffic counter functionality, Connect or Not can be used as an indoor positioning tool, relying on user defined \'fingerprints\'. The user can use an existing map or upload a new one, to which they can add \'fingerprint\' measurements of signal-strengths of GSM, Bluetooth, and WiFi access points at their location. The system will try to locate the user according to these measurement with a precision of less then 2 meters. It is possible to add multiple measurement to a single location, which in turn improves the precision.
ConnectOrNot records the values into a database and transmits them over the network to a remote server and alternatively also using OSC protocol. It is also able to store the values in a .csv file on the SD card and upload them to a remote server. Data is stored anonymously and used for research purposes only (only if you want to contribute – no secret uploads)
To enable data transmission, press the “START” button. To end it, press “STOP”. When you want to clear the application\'s database, press “Reset data” and the app wil re-read the phone’s usage.
Connect or Not works in two modes, “LIVE” and “PLAYBACK”. In "LIVE" mode, data is transmitted directly to the server while in "PLAYBACK" mode it gets stored to the applications database on the phone. It can be then played back to the server at another time, forwards and backwards.
In the main menu, you will find options to Import/Export data to a file, change the mode between Record and Playback and set the sending interval. When exporting data, you can choose to write them to a file on your SD card or Upload to our server.

Icons made by Freepik, Google from www.flaticon.com is licensed by CC BY 3.0
